Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp

Interface SMTPPipeline

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AuthPipeline
    public interface SMTPPipeline
    Generic pipeline interface for SMTP message processing.

    An SMTPPipeline receives notifications at key stages of an SMTP transaction and can optionally receive the raw message bytes. This allows pipelines to perform various processing such as:

    • Email authentication (SPF, DKIM, DMARC)
    • Content filtering and virus scanning
    • Message archiving and journaling
    • Rate limiting and quota enforcement

    SMTPConnection calls the pipeline methods automatically at the appropriate stages. The pipeline can perform checks and invoke callbacks registered during its construction.

    Lifecycle

    1. mailFrom(EmailAddress) - Called when MAIL FROM is received
    2. rcptTo(EmailAddress) - Called for each RCPT TO received
    3. getMessageChannel() - Called at DATA start to get byte channel
    4. Channel.write() - Called as message bytes stream in
    5. Channel.close() - Called at end of DATA transfer
    6. endData() - Called after channel close for final processing
    7. reset() - Called on RSET or after message delivery

    Usage

    Associate a pipeline with an SMTP connection: 

    
 public void connected(SMTPConnectionMetadata metadata) {
     SMTPPipeline pipeline = createMyPipeline();
     metadata.setPipeline(pipeline);
 }
    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    AuthPipeline

      void endData()
      Called when DATA transfer is complete.
      java.nio.channels.WritableByteChannel getMessageChannel()

    • Method Detail

      • mailFrom

        void mailFrom​(EmailAddress sender)
        Called when MAIL FROM is received.

        This is typically the first notification for a new message. Pipelines can use this to perform sender-based checks (e.g., SPF).

        Parameters:
        sender - the envelope sender address, or null for bounce messages

      • rcptTo

        void rcptTo​(EmailAddress recipient)
        Called when RCPT TO is received.

        This may be called multiple times for messages with multiple recipients. Pipelines can use this for recipient-based checks.

        Parameters:
        recipient - the envelope recipient address

      • getMessageChannel

        java.nio.channels.WritableByteChannel getMessageChannel()
        Returns a channel to receive raw message bytes.

        Called when DATA transfer begins. If this returns non-null, SMTPConnection will write raw message bytes to the channel as they arrive, and close the channel at end of transfer.

        Returning null indicates the pipeline doesn't need message bytes.

        Returns:
        a writable byte channel, or null

      • endData

        void endData()
        Called when DATA transfer is complete.

        This is called after the message channel is closed. Pipelines should perform any final processing here (e.g., DKIM verification, DMARC evaluation) and invoke completion callbacks.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Called when the transaction is reset.

        This occurs on RSET command, after successful message delivery, or when the connection is closed. Pipelines should clean up any per-message state.
